meanings.definition: To delay an athlete's participation in competitive games in order to extend their period of eligibility.
meanings.sent1: The coach redshirted the talented player to give them more time to develop.
meanings.sent2: She redshirted last season to have an extra year to compete in college.
meanings.sent3: The athlete joked that being redshirted felt like being put on the sidelines with a fancy shirt.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a tree in winter, redshirted and waiting for the right season to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The decision to redshirt the player was like planting a seed for future success.

meanings.definition: A person who has been redshirted.
meanings.sent1: The redshirted student was excited to finally join the team this year.
meanings.sent2: As a redshirted athlete, she had an extra year to train and improve.
meanings.sent3: The redshirted player stood out on the field with their fresh energy and determination.
meanings.sent4: He was like a hidden gem, a redshirted talent waiting to shine when the time was right.
meanings.sent5: The redshirted individual proved their worth with each game, showing their dedication and skill.
